description: Inherited from Middle English richely, from Old English rīċlīċe, from Proto-West Germanic *rīkīlīkō, from Proto-Germanic *rīkijalīkô; by surface analysis, rich +‎ -ly (adverbial suffix).

adverbs.description: richly (comparative richlier or more richly, superlative richliest or most richly)

definitionGroups.group: In a luxurious manner; full of majesty or expression:

entries.meaning: In an attractive or manner; full of colour or detail.
In a manner that occupies the non-visual senses; flavourfully, deeply.
(of a marriage) Done advantageously, done as to be wealthy.
Thoroughly, totally; in an ample manner.
